Formulate the User Authentication and Password Policies
ASP.NET3.5: Consider using Two Factor Authentication
p: Implement a two-factor authentication system for remote network access.
Two-factor authentication ensures that an attacker cannot use compromised credentials to access the network remotely.

Two-factor authentication requires the use of a password and an additional form of authentication for remote network access. Remote network access typically means VPN, and the VPN server itself commonly implements password-based authentication. The additional
 form of authentication is the challenge of this requirement.

There are multiple products available that satisfy the PCI DSS Requirement 8.3. Two solutions that have positive user feedback are
RSA SecurID tokens, which uses physical tokens and Securenvoy cell-phone based authentication, which sends text messages as an additional form of authentication. It may be helpful to contact the vendors when choosing to make
 sure the solution is compatible with your environment. Either of the above solutions is capable of satisfying the PCI DSS Requirement 8.3. For detailed instructions on implementing either solution, please refer to the vendor's documentation or technical support.
a: Formulate the User Authentication and Password Policies

links.text: Formulate the User Authentication and Password Policies

html:
Applies to

  • PCI DSS Requirement 8.3

What to Do

Implement a two-factor authentication system for remote network access.

Why

Two-factor authentication ensures that an attacker cannot use compromised credentials to access the network remotely.

How

Two-factor authentication requires the use of a password and an additional form of authentication for remote network access. Remote network access typically means VPN, and the VPN server itself commonly implements password-based authentication. The additional form of authentication is the challenge of this requirement.

There are multiple products available that satisfy the PCI DSS Requirement 8.3. Two solutions that have positive user feedback are RSA SecurID tokens, which uses physical tokens and Securenvoy cell-phone based authentication, which sends text messages as an additional form of authentication. It may be helpful to contact the vendors when choosing to make sure the solution is compatible with your environment. Either of the above solutions is capable of satisfying the PCI DSS Requirement 8.3. For detailed instructions on implementing either solution, please refer to the vendor's documentation or technical support.

Additional Resources

  • For more information about Securenvoy, please see "Securenvoy" at http://www.securenvoy.com/.
  • For more information about the RSA SecurID, please see "RSA SecurID" at http://www.rsa.com/node.aspx?id=1156.

Related Items

  • Formulate the User Authentication and Password Policies
  • ASP.NET3.5: Consider using Two Factor Authentication
